review: I bought this when it was first released by Google. It is a neat little device that streams high quality video on my 47" LCD TV. Having to plug it in is a annoying, but I don't have a brand new model TV that supports powering it via HDMI. It's relatively easy to setup, even with an iOS device, and it is recognized by the apps that support it right away. I wish it could handle local media streaming a little bit better, but with Plex capability, that resolves a lot of the issues I had originally.Being able to stream from a Chrome tab is nice as well. I wish Android had the ability to do a screen mirror like the AppleTV does, but Google hasn't built that sort of functionality just yet. Since they opened the API a lot more people are taking advantage of the device, but it's still pretty new yet.

review: we debated on getting a roku box or the chrome cast. deciding that the chrome cast was cheaper we went with it first (thinking it would be easy enough to resell if we did not like it) and ever since we got it we never even thought about getting a roku. Our smart TV has always been dropping connection to the internet etc, but not our chrome cast. Our HDTV has never looked this good streaming!! we love it. It works with all of our devices, macbook,iPad,iPhone. The best controller is via the iPhone though!
